page.title: 05Historic Mills
page.content: Quite a lot of mills in the district are on a stream named the{Squitter {Brook}.It flows into our area at {Robins Mill}.This brook was never very big but it carried a lot of water in the past so they built a lot of mills which had a mill pond.All the mills along the Squitter are corn mills.In past times these mills were used locally and farmers had their corn ground and then sold the flour.The mills along the brook are{Robins, {Upper & Lower Kemerton and Aston {Mills}.None of these work any more , Aston Mill is in a bad state,and Lower Mill was gutted in the 1930s .Today there isn't as much water in the stream because it's extracted upstream in{Overbury}for{drinking water}so if any mills were working they would be able only to do half as much work.On the Carrant is Northway Mill.
